description: A small but feature-rich graph to learn nodes, links, layers, and common graph structures (tree, star, DAG, cycle) using the existing interactions.

profile.title: First Graph: Learn Graphs
items: This template is intentionally small, but it demonstrates multiple graph structures using the same UI interactions.
Try: hover a node ‚Üí see neighbors; click a node ‚Üí open details; search ‚Üí focus; zoom/pan ‚Üí explore clusters.
Goal: learn how nodes/edges/layers map to real-world models (dependencies, hierarchies, hubs, feedback).

basics.title: Graph Basics
items: A graph is a set of nodes connected by edges.
In this UI: parent nodes are larger; child nodes inherit the parent color.

concept-node.title: Node (vertex)
items: A distinct thing: a person, a task, a concept, a page.

concept-edge.title: Edge (link)
items: A relationship between two nodes: depends-on, contains, leads-to, relates-to.

concept-direction.title: Directed vs undirected
items: Dependencies are usually directed (A ‚Üí B). Friendship is often undirected (A ‚Äî B).

concept-weight.title: Weight / cost
items: Edges can carry numbers (time, cost, distance). Shortest-path algorithms use weights.

concept-labels.title: Labels / types
items: Edge types let you encode meaning (e.g., HAS_SUBCATEGORY vs LEADS_TO).

interactions.title: How To Use This Graph
items: This view is interactive. Use the menu buttons and the search box.
Tip: clicking nodes is the best way to learn‚Äîevery node has a short explanation.

ui-hover.title: Hover = highlight neighbors
items: Hover a node to highlight its immediate connections.

ui-click.title: Click = open details
items: Click any node to open its details popup.

ui-search.title: Search = find & focus
items: Use the menu search to jump to a node by name or detail text.

ui-zoom.title: Zoom / pan
items: Scroll/pinch to zoom. Drag the background to pan.

ui-reset.title: Reset view
items: Use Reset View to return to the default zoom and clear highlights.

structures.title: Graph Structures
items: Below are common shapes you will see in real data: trees, stars, DAGs, cycles.
These are not different UIs‚Äîjust different node/edge patterns.

structure-tree.title: Tree (hierarchy)
items: A connected structure with no cycles. Great for categories and org charts.

tree-root.title: Root
items: The top of a hierarchy. Everything flows downward.

tree-branch-a.title: Branch A
items: A subgroup under the root.

tree-branch-b.title: Branch B
items: Another subgroup under the root.

tree-leaf-a1.title: Leaf A1
items: Leaves are terminal nodes in a tree path.

tree-leaf-b1.title: Leaf B1
items: Leaves are often the actionable / concrete items.

structure-star.title: Star (hub & spokes)
items: One central node connected to many others. Common in routing, platforms, and popularity graphs.

star-spoke-1.title: Spoke 1
items: A neighbor connected to the hub.

star-spoke-2.title: Spoke 2
items: A neighbor connected to the hub.

star-spoke-3.title: Spoke 3
items: A neighbor connected to the hub.

star-spoke-4.title: Spoke 4
items: A neighbor connected to the hub.

structure-dag.title: DAG (dependency graph)
items: A directed acyclic graph: edges point forward and there are no cycles.
Used for build pipelines, task scheduling, and prerequisites.

dag-a.title: Task A
items: A prerequisite feeding into multiple tasks.

dag-b.title: Task B
items: Depends on A.

dag-c.title: Task C
items: Also depends on A.

dag-d.title: Task D
items: Combines outputs from B and C.

structure-cycle.title: Cycle (feedback loop)
items: Cycles mean you can return to where you started.
Sometimes desired (feedback systems), sometimes a problem (circular dependencies).

cycle-1.title: State 1
items: Part of a loop.

cycle-2.title: State 2
items: Part of a loop.

cycle-3.title: State 3
items: Part of a loop.

usecase-hierarchy.title: Use Case: Hierarchies
items: Org charts, categories, file/folder trees, taxonomy.

usecase-hub.title: Use Case: Hubs
items: Platforms, routers, central services, influencer networks.

usecase-deps.title: Use Case: Dependencies
items: Task planning, build systems, prerequisites, pipelines.

usecase-feedback.title: Use Case: Feedback Loops
items: Control systems, iteration cycles, reinforcing effects.

outcome.title: Outcome: Pick the Right Model
items: If your data is hierarchical ‚Üí tree.
If you have prerequisites ‚Üí DAG.
If you have a central service ‚Üí star/hub.
If effects reinforce each other ‚Üí cycle/loop.
